column4: Transcription factor required for septum destruction after cytokinesis
column5: part of the RAM network that regulates polarity and morphogenesis
column6: NES phosphorylation by RAM network kinase Cbk1p blocks nuclear exit in mother cells during the M/G1 transition, causing asymmetric localization to daughter cell nuclei, and increased Ace2p activity
column7: phosphorylation by Cdc28p and Pho85p prevents nuclear import during cell cycle phases other than cytokinesis
column8: Spt16p is required for nuclear exclusion during G1

column4: Transcription factor involved in iron utilization and homeostasis
column5: binds consensus site PyPuCACCCPu and activates transcription in response to changes in iron availability
column6: in iron-replete conditions localization is regulated by Grx3p, Grx4p, and Fra2p, and promoter binding is negatively regulated via Grx3p-Grx4p binding
column7: AFT1 has a paralog, AFT2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
column8: relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

column4: Transcription factor involved in regulating arginine-responsive genes
column5: acts with Arg81p and Arg82p

column4: Zinc finger transcription factor involved in arginine-responsive genes
column5: Zn(2)-Cys(6) binuclear cluster domain type
column6: involved in the regulation of arginine-responsive genes
column7: acts with Arg80p and Arg82p

column4: Myb-related transcription factor
column5: involved in regulating basal and induced expression of genes of the purine and histidine biosynthesis pathways
column6: also involved in regulation of meiotic recombination at specific genes

column4: Basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) protein
column5: forms homodimer to bind E-box consensus sequence CACGTG present at MET gene promoters and centromere DNA element I (CDEI)
column6: affects nucleosome positioning at this motif
column7: associates with other transcription factors such as Met4p and Isw1p to mediate transcriptional activation or repression
column8: associates with kinetochore proteins, required for chromosome segregation
column9: protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

column4: DNA binding transcriptional activator
column5: mediates serine/threonine activation of the catabolic L-serine (L-threonine) deaminase (CHA1)
column6: Zinc-finger protein with Zn[2]-Cys[6] fungal-type binuclear cluster domain

column4: Negative regulator of genes in multiple nitrogen degradation pathways
column5: expression is regulated by nitrogen levels and by Gln3p
column6: member of the GATA-binding family, forms homodimers and heterodimers with Gzf3p
column7: DAL80 has a paralog, GZF3, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Forkhead family transcription factor
column5: rate-limiting replication origin activator
column6: evolutionarily conserved lifespan regulator
column7: binds multiple chromosomal elements with distinct specificities, cell cycle dynamics
column8: regulates transcription elongation, chromatin silencing at mating loci, expression of G2/M phase genes
column9: facilitates clustering, activation of early-firing replication origins
column10: binds HML recombination enhancer, regulates donor preference during mating-type switching

column4: Transcriptional activator of nitrogen catabolite repression genes
column5: contains a GATA-1-type zinc finger DNA-binding motif
column6: activity and localization regulated by nitrogen limitation and Ure2p
column7: different translational starts produce two major and two minor isoforms that are differentially regulated and localized

column4: bZIP transcriptional activator of amino acid biosynthetic genes
column5: activator responds to amino acid starvation
column6: expression is tightly regulated at both the transcriptional and translational levels
column7: contains four upstream open reading frames (uORFs) in 5' untranslated region which regulate translation

column4: Transcriptional activator of genes involved in glycolysis
column5: interacts and functions with the DNA-binding protein Gcr1p

column4: Transcriptional activator in nitrogen catabolite repression system
column5: localization and activity regulated by quality of nitrogen source and Ure2p
column6: full-length protein forms prion-like aggregates when overproduced

column4: GATA zinc finger protein
column5: negatively regulates nitrogen catabolic gene expression by competing with Gat1p for GATA site binding
column6: function requires a repressive carbon source
column7: dimerizes with Dal80p and binds to Tor1p
column8: GZF3 has a paralog, DAL80, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Zinc finger transcription factor
column5: involved in the complex regulation of gene expression in response to levels of heme and oxygen
column6: localizes to the mitochondrion as well as to the nucleus
column7: the S288C sequence differs from other strain backgrounds due to a Ty1 insertion in the carboxy terminus

column4: Subunit of the Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex
column5: complex is heme-activated and glucose-repressed
column6: complex is a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression
column7: contains sequences sufficient for both complex assembly and DNA binding
column8: respiratory defect of the null mutant is functionally complemented by human NFYA

column4: Subunit of the Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex
column5: complex is heme-activated and glucose-repressed
column6: complex is a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression
column7: contains sequences contributing to both complex assembly and DNA binding

column4: Transcription factor
column5: subunit of the heme-activated, glucose-repressed Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex, a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression
column6: provides the principal activation function of the complex
column7: involved in diauxic shift

column4: Subunit of the Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex
column5: complex is heme-activated and glucose repressed
column6: complex is a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression
column7: required for assembly and DNA binding activity of the complex

column4: Transcription factor
column5: component of the heteromeric Ino2p/Ino4p basic helix-loop-helix transcription activator that binds inositol/choline-responsive elements (ICREs), required for derepression of phospholipid biosynthetic genes in response to inositol depletion
column6: involved in diauxic shift

column4: Transcription factor involved in phospholipid synthesis
column5: required for derepression of inositol-choline-regulated genes involved in phospholipid synthesis
column6: forms a complex, with Ino2p, that binds the inositol-choline-responsive element through a basic helix-loop-helix domain

column4: Zinc-knuckle transcription factor, repressor and activator
column5: regulates genes involved in branched chain amino acid biosynthesis and ammonia assimilation
column6: acts as a repressor in leucine-replete conditions and as an activator in the presence of alpha-isopropylmalate, an intermediate in leucine biosynthesis that accumulates during leucine starvation

column4: Transcription factor
column5: involved in regulation of cell cycle progression from G1 to S phase, forms a complex with Swi6p that binds to MluI cell cycle box regulatory element in promoters of DNA synthesis genes

column4: bZIP transcriptional activator in the Cbf1p-Met4p-Met28p complex
column5: participates in the regulation of sulfur metabolism

column4: Transcription factor involved in glucose repression
column5: sequence specific DNA binding protein containing two Cys2His2 zinc finger motifs
column6: regulated by the SNF1 kinase and the GLC7 phosphatase
column7: regulates filamentous growth along with Mig2p in response to glucose depletion
column8: activated in stochastic pulses of nuclear localization, shuttling between cytosol and nucleus depending on external glucose levels and its phosphorylation state

column4: Stress-responsive transcriptional activator
column5: activated in stochastic pulses of nuclear localization in response to various stress conditions
column6: binds DNA at stress response elements of responsive genes
column7: light sensing pathway component that accumulates in the nucleus in response to blue light
column8: relative distribution to nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

column4: Transcriptional repressor
column5: recruits the Cyc8p-Tup1p complex to promoters
column6: mediates glucose repression and negatively regulates a variety of processes including filamentous growth and alkaline pH response
column7: activated in stochastic pulses of nuclear localization in response to low glucose

column4: Transcriptional activator that enhances pseudohyphal growth
column5: physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets
column6: regulates expression of FLO11, an adhesin required for pseudohyphal filament formation
column7: similar to StuA, an A. nidulans developmental regulator
column9: PHD1 has a paralog, SOK2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Major transcriptional repressor of DNA-damage-regulated genes
column5: recruits repressors Tup1p and Cyc8p to their promoters
column6: involved in DNA damage and replication checkpoint pathway
column7: similar to a family of mammalian DNA binding RFX1-4 proteins

column4: Basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) transcription factor of the myc-family
column5: activates transcription cooperatively with Pho2p in response to phosphate limitation
column6: binding to 'CACGTG' motif is regulated by chromatin restriction, competitive binding of Cbf1p to the same DNA binding motif and cooperation with Pho2p
column7: function is regulated by phosphorylation at multiple sites and by phosphate availability

column4: Glucose-responsive transcription factor
column5: regulates expression of several glucose transporter (HXT) genes in response to glucose
column6: binds to promoters and acts both as a transcriptional activator and repressor
column7: recruits Tup1p/Cyc8p to target gene promoters
column8: RGT1 has a paralog, EDS1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Cys2His2 zinc-finger transcriptional repressor
column5: involved in alkaline responsive gene repression as part of adaptation to alkaline conditions
column6: involved in cell wall assembly
column7: required for alkaline pH-stimulated haploid invasive growth and sporulation
column8: activated by alkaline-dependent proteolytic processing which results in removal of the C-terminal tail

column4: Heme-dependent repressor of hypoxic genes
column5: mediates aerobic transcriptional repression of hypoxia induced genes such as COX5b and CYC7
column6: repressor function regulated through decreased promoter occupancy in response to oxidative stress
column7: contains an HMG domain that is responsible for DNA bending activity
column8: involved in the hyperosmotic stress resistance

column4: Transcription factor that stimulates expression of proteasome genes
column5: Rpn4p levels are in turn regulated by the 26S proteasome in a negative feedback control mechanism
column6: RPN4 is transcriptionally regulated by various stress responses
column7: relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

column4: Transcription factor (bHLH) involved in interorganelle communication
column5: contributes to communication between mitochondria, peroxisomes, and nucleus
column6: target of Hog1p
column7: activated in stochastic pulses of nuclear localization

column4: bHLH/Zip transcription factor for retrograde (RTG) and TOR pathways
column5: forms a complex with another bHLH/Zip protein, Rtg1p, to activate the pathways
column6: target of Hog1p

column4: Nuclear response regulator and transcription factor
column5: physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets
column6: part of a branched two-component signaling system
column7: required for optimal induction of heat-shock genes in response to oxidative stress
column9: relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
column10: SKN7 has a paralog, HMS2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Nuclear protein that negatively regulates pseudohyphal differentiation
column5: plays a regulatory role in the cyclic AMP (cAMP)-dependent protein kinase (PKA) signal transduction pathway
column6: relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
column7: SOK2 has a paralog, PHD1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Transcription factor
column5: involved in regulating multidrug resistance and oxidative stress response
column6: forms a heterodimer with Pdr1p
column7: contains a Zn(II)2Cys6 zinc finger domain that interacts with a pleiotropic drug resistance element in vitro

column4: Transcriptional repressor that regulates middle-sporulation genes
column5: required for mitotic repression of middle sporulation-specific genes
column6: also acts as general replication initiation factor
column7: involved in telomere maintenance, chromatin silencing

column4: DNA binding component of the SBF complex (Swi4p-Swi6p)
column5: a transcriptional activator that in concert with MBF (Mbp1-Swi6p) regulates late G1-specific transcription of targets including cyclins and genes required for DNA synthesis and repair
column6: Slt2p-independent regulator of cold growth
column7: acetylation at two sites, K1016 and K1066, regulates interaction with Swi6p

column4: Transcription factor that recruits Mediator and Swi/Snf complexes
column5: activates transcription of genes expressed at the M/G1 phase boundary and in G1 phase
column6: required for expression of the HO gene controlling mating type switching
column7: localization to nucleus occurs during G1 and appears to be regulated by phosphorylation by Cdc28p kinase
column8: SWI5 has a paralog, ACE2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Transcription factor targeting filamentation genes and Ty1 expression
column5: Ste12p activation of most filamentation gene promoters depends on Tec1p and Tec1p transcriptional activity is dependent on its association with Ste12p
column6: binds to TCS elements upstream of filamentation genes, which are regulated by Tec1p/Ste12p/Dig1p complex
column7: competes with Dig2p for binding to Ste12p/Dig1p
column8: positive regulator of chronological life span

column4: Nitrogen catabolite repression transcriptional regulator
column5: inhibits GLN3 transcription in good nitrogen source
column6: role in sequestering Gln3p and Gat1p to the cytoplasm
column7: has glutathione peroxidase activity and can mutate to acquire GST activity
column8: self-assembly under limited nitrogen conditions creates [URE3] prion and releases catabolite repression

column4: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor
column5: required for oxidative stress tolerance
column6: activated by H2O2 through the multistep formation of disulfide bonds and transit from the cytoplasm to the nucleus
column7: Yap1p is degraded in the nucleus after the oxidative stress has passed
column9: relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress
column10: YAP1 has a paralog, CAD1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

column4: Zinc-regulated transcription factor
column5: binds to zinc-responsive promoters to induce transcription of certain genes in presence of zinc, represses other genes in low zinc
column6: regulates its own transcription
column7: contains seven zinc-finger domains
